qas.question: What group dominated the political scene when Mubarak was in power?
What laws created in 1990s impacted culture?

answers.text: 1993 Syndicates Law, 1995 Press Law, and 1999 Nongovernmental Associations Law

qas.question: When did parliamentary politics become irrelevant in Egypt?

context: During Mubarak's reign, the political scene was dominated by the <a0_0>National Democratic Party,<a0_0/> which was created by Sadat in 1978. It passed the <a1_0>1993 Syndicates Law, 1995 Press Law, and 1999 Nongovernmental Associations Law<a1_0/> which hampered freedoms of association and expression by imposing new regulations and draconian penalties on violations.[citation needed] As a result, by the <a2_0>late 1990s<a2_0/> parliamentary politics had become virtually irrelevant and alternative avenues for political expression were curtailed as well.
